jml.basics
Class Result

java.lang.Object
  jml.basics.Result
Direct Known Subclasses:
DFAEvoResult, ExperimentResults, IterativeAlgorithmStatistics, PopulationStatistics, SimpleResult
public abstract class Result
extends java.lang.Object

Title: Result

Description: This class represents the results generated by an algorithm. This class provides methods for calculating statistical information of the execution of the algorithm (for experimental analysis), In particular, this class provides the basic methods used by an experiment to calculate average and variance. If the results of the algorithm will not contain statistical information then the results can be inherited from the class SimpleResult.

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2004

Company: Universidad Nacional de Colombia

Version:
1.0
Author:
Jonatan Gomez

public Result()
Method Detail

sum

public abstract void sum(Result other)
Add the statistics object with the given statistic object. Every class that extends Result has to cast the Statistic object given as argument to its own class. Suppose class A extends Result

class A extends Result{

protected double val = 0.0;

public A( double v ){ val = v; }

...

public void sum( Result other ){

if( other instanceof A ){

A o = (A)other;

val += o.val;

}

}

}

Here the sum method determines if the Result object other belongs to the same class (A), if it is true then cast the object to the class and perform the sum operation

Parameters:
other - The statistic object that will be added to the Statistic object

substract

public abstract void substract(Result other)
Substract the statistics object with the given statistic object. Every class that extends Result has to cast the Statistic object given as argument to its own class. This method is useful for calculating the variance. Suppose class A extends Result

class A extends Result{

protected double val = 0.0;

...

public void substract( Result other ){

if( other instanceof A ){

A o = (A)other;

val -= o.val;

}

}

}

Here the substract method determines if the Result object other belongs to the same class (A), if it is true then cast the object to the class and perform the substract operation

Parameters:
other - The statistic object that will be substracted from the Statistic object

divide

public abstract void divide(double n)
Divide the statistical object by the number given. Suppose class A extends Result

class A extends Result{

protected double val = 0.0;

...

public void divide( double n ){

val /= n;

}

}

}

Here the divide method divides by n the appropiated attributes of the object

Parameters:
n - The number used to divide the object

square

public abstract void square()
multiply the statistical object by itself. This method is very useful for calculating the variance. Suppose class A extends Result

class A extends Result{

protected double val = 0.0;

...

public void square(){

val *= val;

}

}

}

Here the square method squares the appropiated attributes of the object

sqrt

public abstract void sqrt()
get the square root of the statistical object. This method is useful for calculating the standard deviation. Suppose class A extends Result

class A extends Result{

protected double val = 0.0;

...

public void sqrt(){

val = Math.sqrt(val);

}

}

}

Here the sqrt method gets the square root of the appropiated attributes of the object

average

public static Result average(Result[] x)
Calculates the average Result object of a given collection of Result objects. All the objects in the argument collection should belong to the same class. In other case the average will be not calculated.

Parameters:
x - A collection of Result objects
Returns:
The average Result object of a given collection of Result objects
